My best meal hack is to double the amount of protein I cook so I can use it the next night in a different recipe. Cooking meat is the messiest and most time consuming part of cooking for me.
I also try to wash all my fruits and veggies the day I bring them home. I'm more likely to use them if I know they are even just part way ready to go!
Lastly, once a week I make double batch of soup. I freeze it in wide mouth half size canning jars. They fit perfectly in the door of my freezer and are so nice to have something to grab and eat, or heat and take with you.
Thanks for your video, I always enjoy them!
Yes I do the same thing. I cook meat for at least 2 days because it’s messy.

This really does help!  Being single I find it hard sometimes and I was wasting alot of food. So decided to sit down and write out what I wanted to make for a 2 week period. Then like you I planned my grocery list and it worked out pretty well.

This is super similar to my meal planning system!! Except I plan the dinners specifically on a monthly basis (its overwhelming for me to do it 4 times a month so I like to get it all over with and just do it once a month!). Lunches are hard for me. If I don't pick a specific meal to make that week I will end up eating something not so great. I typically pick a soup (NEED your soup recipe you made this week!) or your chickpea curry in a hurry and eat that for my lunches. Those are easy to reheat. I need more inspo though! 😁

I’ve recently switched from intense meal prepping to chill meal planning because I finished my degree and so much of my time was freed up and I realized I could take the time to cook each night or a few times a week but I still love being prepared because life be crazy when you least expect it!

Great video! Question- when you store lettuce in the salad spinner do you just leave it in just the inner open mesh part, put a lid, cover it some way?
What about the excess water, dump it or keep it in the container?
Yes I store it in the inner mesh part still in the main container and just keep the lid on. It stays crisp and fresh for 3-4 days I love this hack.
